attributes.action: Speed limit to be reduced from 40mph to 30mph
attributes.additional_details: Would like the government to get in touch with out local council and getting our speed limit reduced in our village cars come through here miles to fast and 30 is more than plenty fast enough. We get road raged at trying to pull in and out of our own drive tooted hand signals it's not very nice
attributes.background: We have a lot of safety issues in Hanley Castle having a school is one with the 40mph speed limit and of course people's pets cats etc etc also we have never ever seen any speed checks since being here

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The speed limit in Hanley Castle is the responsibility of Malvern Hills District council.

You can find out which local authority is responsible for different speed limits using a postcode and this website: https://www.gov.uk/request-speed-limit-change  

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here: 

https://www.malvernhills.gov.uk/about-your-council/your-local-council/petitions
